conclusion: Analyze the image to understand positions of charges and cube geometry.

The image shows a cube with vertices labeled. Two point charges are at vertices: one with charge $2q$ and another with charge $-q$. Side length is $L$. Point $A$ is another vertex. Midpoint $O$ of the line connecting the charges is marked.
Electric field at midpoint $O$ is the sum of fields due to the two charges. Fields are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction, resulting in net field of $0$ at $O$.
Electric field due to a point charge is given by Coulomb's law: $E = k \frac{q}{r^2}$.
Distance from charge $2q$ to point $A$ is the same as from charge $-q$ to point $A$ because $A$ is a vertex of the cube.
Since electric field at $O$ is $0$, fields from the two charges cancel each other out at $O$.
Magnitude of electric field at point $A$ will be the same as at $O$.
Magnitude of electric field at $O$ is given as $E$.
Magnitude of electric field at point $A$ is also $E$.
